snippet: A divisive labor bill is back in Republican hands after Indiana House Democrats on Monday ended a three-day boycott of the chamber to stall the measure.
abstract: Democrats return to the Indiana House after a three-day boycott protesting right-to-work bill proposed by Republicans; they may not stay long enough to allow a vote, saying measure is aimed at breaking unions.
lead_paragraph: A divisive labor bill is back in Republican hands after Indiana House Democrats on Monday ended a three-day boycott of the chamber to stall the measure.

headline.print_headline: Indiana: Democrats Return, at Least For a Day
